file_content.text: Good day, my lord. Mos Ila's generators are functioning at full capacity.
Mos Ila is fully powered, sir. Thank you for your assistance.
The generators are up and running. Thank you for everything.
You've got the power cores! I never thought I'd be this happy to see an alien.
You're walking a thin line, bigot.
The feeling isn't mutual.
I'm sorry, I--I meant no offense. Please, I won't make the mistake again.
I knew you'd get the cores! I'll put them to use immediately.
Imperial dominance is crucial. The Jawas won't soon forget.
Anything for the Empire.
I'm glad you were here to crack the whip.
I've got other contracts to attend to.
My job's done here.
Of course. I'm sorry--this is just so exciting.
What's the next step?
I'll remain here to monitor the machinery, make sure nothing overloads.
I'm just relieved it's over.
I'm glad to hear that.
Once the generators regain power, the Empire can finally control all of Mos Ila. You've performed a great service for us all.
About time someone stomped a few Jawas.
How fortunate, my lord. You grace me with your presence just as the Empire needs your talents most.
You're a welcome sight, sir. I have a problem crucial to Imperial control over this sector. I could use your guidance.
You look like you've seen your share of combat. Please stay a moment. I could use your services.
These generators once provided power to most of Mos Ila. The Empire needs them reactivated, but the Jawas are getting in my way.
They built these machines when they controlled the town. Now that I'm converting their inane tech for Imperial use, the Jawas won't hand over the special power cores I require.
Take what you need. If they refuse, punish them.
The Jawas don't have a choice.
I don't have enough forces to attack. I tried brokering a trade instead, but the Jawas wouldn't surrender the cores!
What's so special about those power cores?
Power cores?
It's custom Jawa technology. I tried trading for them, but the runts refused!
They claim they're being used to power droids, some kind of defense against the Exchange. Likely excuse!
The Empire can't tolerate insubordination. Perhaps you could massacre their camp, destroy their droids and bring their power cores to me for the glory and defense of the Empire?
Nothing like demolishing a civilization to really get the blood flowing.
I can go for some destruction.
It's about time someone put the fear of Sith in the Jawas.
I'll show them who's in power.
Indeed, my lord. Remind them of your supremacy.
The punishment for defiance must be swift and ruthless.
I'll discipline them harshly.
I knew you'd understand. Thank you, sir.
I'll get your power cores, but my help doesn't come cheap.
If the pay's right, I'm in.
Thank you! I'll make sure you're taken care of.
Don't make me regret this.
I'd never involve you in something trivial.
The Jawas set up their defenses outside of town. I'll show you.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
I understand. Please excuse me, I must look for some other way to repair these generators.
Spare me your excuses. If these cores are important, I'll get them.
Enough talking. I'll help.
Thank you! The Jawas are using them to power their droids. Smash them, and the cores are yours.
Sorry, I'm busy. This blasted Jawa tech doesn't make any sense!
